name: Under the Weather
description: MERN stack app that is used to track illness/injury symptoms.  This app allows users to sign up for an account and store their symptoms so they can use this information when they visit a primary care physician.  A lot of us seem to magically forget what's been going on while "Under the Weather" and this app is used to help that

name: Phrasing!
description: This was one of the first apps I made using React.  Demonstrates the single page application and how it can be used to render content very quick.  Simple but a fun concept and small things like this can be used for practice.

name: Park U
description: This my first attempt at a full stack application.  I made a game from scratch that was modeled, in a way, after the original Pokemon games and was intended to be a journey through a coding bootcamp.  Uses Node.js with Express routing and a SQL database and just your standard HTML/CSS front-end with jQuery.

name: Put Ya Thang Down...
description: I made this app to demonstrate a little bit of front-end design and some simple functionality.  Has a theme that you may or may not pick up on ;)

name: Parks and Rec Trivia
description: In this project my goal to practice using timeout and interval functions.  I found this really useful because I see different sites or apps with content that will rotate in and out or scroll across the page at a set speed.  I know what I reinforced through this project will be something I use often so I'm glad I can do stuff like this to practice.

name: Word Gallows
description: This was my first real project with javascript and designing/building a webpage on my own.  This was a challenge for me not only because I like to choose more difficult tasks to take on but also because there was a huge learning curve as I went into this knowing very little.  In the end I found it turned out better than I had initially hoped!
